title: Low logic always amazes me
body:
Whenever I play with low ELO friends or smurfing in low elo I always see the dumbest starting items and it just amazes me.
Low ELO seem to HATE going potions and when I ask them about it they say "I don't like to waste gold"
And as the game goes on a lot of them seem to hate boots. The item doesn't do damage so they see it as a waste of gold.

I know these people, they are smart people and very capable people irl, but why are they so dumb in game? lol
Even when explaining things to them and they see the logic, they refuse to put it into practice and it just dumbfounds me. It's like they lose all their intelligence the moment they log into League.

You wanna hear some actual low logic?
Some time ago (like more than half a year ago) I started a new account, while I was doing my first like, I dunno 10 games or so? It doesn't let you PvP yet so I was doing bots...
I had this guy on my team who started the game off and went to lane without any items so naturally I assumed it was either a real starter to LoL or a scripted bot. I asked him about it and uhh...

...he responded with "I'm saving up the 500G for better items later on"...

made me chuckle :P

it's about frame of reference.

For most new people consumable bonus effective health that occurs over a short period of time isn't very beneficial. If they are being punished, they will continue to be punished.

It's obviously not a waste of gold if it saves your life, but short of that, they don't see the value in eating a potion in a moment where they are likely screwed anyway and so it feels like a waste of gold. They don't want to do the math in the heat of battle.

Correctly using potions is a mechanic itself, and so newbies actually would benefit a lot more from {{item:1006}} {{item:1054}}  than potions.

This, it's like, the theorycrafting makes sense, based on the amount of knowledge they have currently. It's like how having played LoL, you can kinda theorycraft for Dota2 or even something as far as Paladins or Overwatch, everything makes sense in the theorycrafting, but only based on how much someone actually knows. In theory, this, this and that should makes sense and work, unless there are any specific exceptions that the player has yet to learn etc.

It's like how someone could definitely assume:
1 - Most ADCs scale well from attack speed
2 - Jhin is an ADC
3 - Thus Jhin most likely scales well with attack speed

It makes sense and the logic is sound, but of course is an exception.
That's why I forgive new players let's say buying items with a bit of mana on Vladimir or Mordekaiser, or in the example's case, getting a tad attack speed on Jhin etc


Of course that's just examples, Jhin's builds can still be diverse but I hope that gets my point across

The three things that always amaze me most are:  

- Completing Tier-2 boots before finishing an item (I see this especially on Low Elo ADCs) or building Tier-2 boots first.  I saw people in GOLD do that shit... granted I'm sure they were MMR boosted, because no one would ordinarily do that.  When you ask them about it they either tell you to "stfu" or "I need movement speed, duh".  

- Rushing Rabadons first or second.  You see this and you know you're dealing with someone that just doesn't grasp the concept of the game.  Even in ARAM, when I see a mana champ start needlessly large rod I just laugh.  

- Building Shiv/Phantom Dancer before ANY damage item on an ADC.  Now, I know that there are people that like a Shiv start on Vayne, personally I don't get it.  I can understand the people that build B.F. Sword and then Shiv, but flat out building phantom dancer or Shiv or BOTH before damage just makes me cringe every time.  

There are other things I see low MMR players do that are head-scratching, but those are the biggest three.  

Honorable mentions though... 

- Falling behind top lane, but still building damage as opposed to building defensively.  Again, there are exceptions to every rule, but in general... TopLane101 - if you're behind, play and build defensively.  Granted, that was advice you would give before Season 7, now the advice is, "just try not to feed", because if you give up a kill in top lane, the lane is over and you've lost your tower.  

- Not building sightstone on supports/not using wards/buying control wards on other laners.  This isn't just limited to low Elo play though, but I used to see far too many supports in Bronze and Silver that literally refused to buy sightstone or even a support item.  Not to mention the other solo laners (including the adc) that wouldn't ward or buy control wards.  This type of stubborn play even happens in gold, A LOT.
Well, technically, if they go into lane and perfectly dodge and also consistently defeat their opponent, potions are a waste of gold.
